definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: Description, Wind is whistling, play happily in the beautiful sea.
sentences.chinese: 有海風低吟淺唱，跟海豚一起找尋海底的祕密。

sentences.english: In the country, he can hear birds singing and sheep bleating .
sentences.chinese: 在鄉下，他能聽到鳥兒的鳴唱和綿羊的低吟。

sentences.english: She reminded me of hermother. I began to whisper a poem intoher ear.
sentences.chinese: 我在她耳旁低吟起一首小詩。

sentences.english: When these breezes reached the platform the palm-fronds would whisper.
sentences.chinese: 微風吹到平臺時，棕櫚葉片發出簌簌的低吟。

sentences.english: You are the cause of this song without pause.
sentences.chinese: 正是因爲你們的緣故，我一直低吟着《子衿》。

sentences.english: Slip a diaper under the tush, and the baby coos?
sentences.chinese: 墊一片尿布在嬰兒的小屁股下，嬰兒只會咕咕地低吟？

sentences.english: The children murmured as they memorized the poem.
sentences.chinese: 小孩們背誦詩時發出低吟。
彩星，在她的低吟淺唱中。

sentences.english: Spring has no speech, nothing but rustling of and whispering.
sentences.chinese: 春天沒有言語，只有漸颯和低吟。

sentences.english: They crooned for the death, or cried for the future.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲死亡而低吟，或者爲未來而哭泣。

sentences.english: It is fine to listen to the humming light spring to sing it?
sentences.chinese: 它在細耳聆聽春天的低吟淺唱嗎？

sentences.english: Piously got to sing, and to chant, for her destiny.
sentences.chinese: 她虔誠地高歌且低吟，唱着她的命運。

sentences.english: The tires sang over the highway.
sentences.chinese: 輪胎在公路上嚓嚓低吟。

sentences.english: Daily will you accompany me in whisper;
Only another winding will this stream make, only another murmur in this glade
sentences.chinese: 這條小溪只能再蜿蜒一次，在沼地裏再低吟一回。

sentences.english: "Where are you. Come back again I want you to. ""Not now girl.
sentences.chinese: 這樣反覆悲傷的低吟一定是首望不見未來的情人的歌。

definition: to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
to talk in one's sleep/crazy talk
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
talking in one's sleep/delirious ravings/nonsense/sheer fantasy
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
